news.title: Portugal's Mota-Engil reports 54% rise in net profit in Q1 2024
news.para: The construction company, which operates in 20 countries across Africa, Europe and Latin America, said net profit totalled 20 million euros for January to March, up from 13 million euros a year earlier.

news.title: Germany property trough worsens as foreign investors scale back
news.para: The grim figures coincide with a debate about whether Germany is once again "the sick man of Europe" - a label it was given in late 1990s as it struggled with economic stagnation and high unemployment.

news.title: China will control property sector risk: Vice Premier
news.para: China is seeking to restore confidence in its financial system, which is mired in a property crisis and mounting local government debt, as the economy faces a host of challenges.

news.title: Action Construction Equipment's net profit up 108.80% in Q4 FY24
news.para: Action Construction Equipment's net consolidated total income stood at Rs 856.76 crore in Q4 FY24, a growth of 38.87 per cent from Rs 616.96 crore it recorded in the similar quarter last year.

news.title: JSW Cement to invest around Rs 3,000 crore to establish cement facility in Rajasthan
news.para: The investment in the new cement facility includes a clinkerization unit of up to 3.30 MTPA and a grinding unit of up to 2.50 MTPA, along with an 18 MW waste heat recovery based power plant.

news.title: Shriram Properties to jointly develop four acre land in Yelahanka, Bengaluru
news.para: The proposed project will comprise of 270 apartments with an aggregate saleable area of ~3.8 lakh sq ft. It has aggregate revenue potential of over Rs 250 crores and is expected to be developed over the next three years.

news.title: India Cements to sell surplus land to augment cash flow
news.para: India Cements sold non-core assets worth Rs 42 crore in FY24 to fund cash flow requirements and efficiency improvement. Loss decreased to Rs 29.3 crore in Q4 FY24 with revenue declining by 14.7%.

news.title: Goa: Even after HC rap, illegal sand mining on in Ragada, say locals
news.para: Ragada, a tributary of the Mhadei, rises in the hilly terrain of the Western Ghats in Karnataka and enters Goa through the Tambdi Surla forest.

news.title: NFRA bars auditors of Reliance Home Finance & Reliance Commercial Finance
news.para: Auditor of Reliance Capital, another group company, had faced similar action last month. Anil Ambani's financial services group faced insolvency action and accounting frauds at group companies may increase the headache.

news.title: Yamuna authority submits complaint against SDS Infracon for diverting Rs 182 crore
news.para: Around 1,400 homebuyers invested in the SDS group’s integrated NRI Township project, spread across 125 acres of land in YEIDA’s Sector 26A, in 2010 and are still waiting for the plots.

news.title: Need legal reforms for more efficient resolution of real estate cases under IBC: Study
news.para: ​In its study, the Indian Institute of Insolvency Professionals of ICAI (IIIPI) has suggested the focus should be on the completion of projects and allotment to home buyers, wherever possible, and added that procedural and co-ordinational issues should not be allowed as a hindrance.

news.title: Dvok Buildcon buys 18-acre land in Gurugram for Rs 310 crore
news.para: Dvok Buildcon has purchased agricultural land near Manesar and paid Rs 21.72 crore as stamp duty, according to the documents.

news.title: British Land sells 50% stake in Meadowhall Shopping Centre for $457 million
news.para: High interest rates and incessant macro-economic worries have dampened a tentative recovery in the highly leveraged British commercial property sector from pandemic lows, while the office space portfolio has struggled amid evolving work habits.

news.title: Asking prices for houses in UK hit record high: Rightmove
news.para: The average asking price for residential properties touched 375,131 pounds ($474,578.23) in the four weeks to mid-May, Rightmove said.

news.title: Shares of most developers in China fall despite latest support measures
news.para: It has gained around 18% so far this month after the Politburo said in an April 30 meeting that it would coordinate to clear housing inventory.

news.title: IIFL Home Finance's net profit increases by 32% in FY24
news.para: IIFL Home Finance's asset under management (AUM) increased from Rs 28,512 crore in FY23 to Rs 35,499 crore in FY24, witnessing a 25% year-on-year growth, with an average ticket size of Rs 14.26 lakh.

news.title: Arpwood Partners to acquire majority stake in SEWA Grih Rin with equity commitment of Rs 680 crore
news.para: Arpwood Partners has committed to invest Rs 680 crore and acquire a majority stake in SEWA Grih Rin. The company has assets under management (AUM) of about Rs 1,200 crore with 25,000+ customers.
